title: Gallery Talk: Word and Image: 20th-Century Women
hero_caption: <p>Elizabeth Sparhawk-Jones, <em>The Shoe Shop</em>, c. 1911. William Owen Goodman and Erna Sawyer Goodman Collection.&nbsp;</p>
description:
With the continued industrialization and the rapid growth of American cities in the early 20th century, women’s roles experienced notable changes. By comparing visual images to other historical source materials, we will look at the ways women engaged in the rising consumer culture of the time.
